Laurian Gridinoc wrote:
> 
> 
> On 20/04/07, Paul Jack <pjack@... <mailto:pjack%40archive.org>> 
> wrote:
>  > I don't believe we ship any automatic recovery tools. Though
>  > something like this could be built using the hcc APIs.
> 
> Is there any recipe to start from command line heritrix on an
> order.xml in recovery mode?

Having recovered heritrix a bit myself, I'll try to answer this.
It's been extremely rare that I've dealt with two recoveries in one day, 
so I haven't done it in an automated manner.

If you need to, you could write a shell script which does:

Each time create a new job directory, like 
CRAWL-NAME-001-RECOVER<sequence number>, where "sequence number" is 
incremented each time, copy over your order.xml from the previous job 
directory and
1) modify all the paths/crawl name to reflect the new job name 
"CRAWL-NAME-001-RECOVER<sequence number>" -- here at the Archive, we 
usually leave one parameter, the arc file prefix, unmodified, since 
we're considering the results all part of the same crawl.
2) set <string name="recover-path"></string> in the order file to point 
to either the last checkpoint (or if you're not using checkpoints, a 
concatenation of all the recover.gz logs to date, in order -- I believe 
you will have gunzip them first.)

(You could accomplish both of those with careful use of sed, or perhaps 
even better, XSLT)

then
heritrix <usual options> -r path-to-jobdir/order.xml
